Data: Utseya to Haddin, no run flight! On middle and off, Haddin reaches out and defends
Utseya to Haddin, no run slightly shorter length, Haddin stays back this time and defends
Utseya to Haddin, no run leans out and gets to the flight to defend again. Three men in the deep on the leg side
Utseya to Haddin, no run
Utseya to Haddin, no run another yes-no situation, Haddin works him with the spin off the pads to square leg. He runs, Watto doesn't. He stops, Watto charges. All order restored in the end.
Utseya to Haddin, no run maiden for Utseya, Haddin stays back and check-drives the last ball to the leg side
Price to Watson, 1 run flat and fast, Watson stays back and punches through mid on for a single
Price to Haddin, no run Haddin plays off the front foot, defends to the leg side
Price to Haddin, no run slows one in the air for a change, Haddin is nearly foxed as he presses forward early. Defence to the leg side
Price to Haddin, 1 run finally Haddin gets the single, on drive through widish mid on and the strike rotates
Price to Watson, 1 run speared in onto middle and leg again, Watson drives cautiously to long on for another single
Price to Haddin, no run hint of turn away from the right hander, he comes forward and pushes with the spin into the covers
Utseya to Watson, no run flighted on middle and leg, worked off the pads to midwicket
Utseya to Watson, no run outside off this time, Watson drives into the covers. Can't get the gap. Watson gets a change of bats.
Utseya to Watson, no run full length outside off, Watto plays back to it and defends down the track.
Utseya to Watson, 1 run Single! Celebrate. Full outside off, Watto drives into the covers and surprise, surprise - he finds the gap
Utseya to Haddin, no run on Haddin's pads, he works it to the leg side. No run

Utseya to Haddin, no run Ah, what happened there? One of those rare occasions when the ball hit the stumps without disturbing the bails, I reckon. Replays awaited. Flat and turning in from Utseya, Haddin was keen to work it to the leg side, he played all around it as opened his stance and looked to fl

Mpofu to Watson, FOUR runs 116 kph, rare loose delivery from Mpofu. In fact, just his second in the day as he delivers the full offcutter on leg stump. Once again, Watson tucks in with a flick through square leg

Mpofu to Watson, FOUR runs finally Australia realise this is not the World Test Championship. Mpofu bangs a short, friendly offcutter and Watson cracks the pull shot with the kind of fluency he showed in the Ashes. No one had a chance as it flew away well in front of square
Mpofu to Watson, 1 run back of a length and very close to off, the patent on one knee steer to third man from Watson.

Mpofu to Haddin, FOUR runs Haddin opens up now. He set himself up for the drive as he took a step out of the crease, but Mpofu kept it short of the length. That did not deter Haddin, who just extended the arms and swat-dragged it over wide mid on. Clean hit
Mpofu to Haddin, no run Mpofu responds with a bouncer, Haddin was charging again, but decided to back out of the shot

Mpofu to Haddin, FOUR runs silky smooth and slick from Haddin as Australia get 17 off the over. Back of a length, in fact too short outside off. It was there for cross-batted brutalisation through the off side, but Haddin decided to deal with finesse. He just waved the wand through the line, the way D
Utseya to Watson, 1 run very fill and straight, Watson drives past the bowler for a single

Utseya to Haddin, 1 run ah, Hadiin drives in the same direction as Utseya dives into Watson as he looks to stop it. Most people can't find a way past Watson. Utseya doesn't either. Single down the ground
Utseya to Watson, 1 run
Utseya to Haddin, no run full outside off, driven into the off side

Utseya to Haddin, no run lovely fielding from Ervine, saves four runs for his side. Tossed up outside off, Haddin drives against the spin and it seems headed for the cover boundary. Ervine goes completely horizontal as he runs from mid off and dives, and collects cleanly with the left arm. Not even a
Utseya to Haddin, 1 run bunts the last delivery to the leg side for a single
Price to Haddin, no run flat and quick on off stump, punched to the off side and Price charges away to his left to stop it
Price to Haddin, no run flat again, on the pads, Haddin works it straight to square leg
Price to Haddin, 1 run this time he gets the single, working it off the pads for one
Price to Watson, 1 run Watson now, hangs back in the crease and deflects through square leg for a single
Price to Haddin, no run
Price to Haddin, 1 run tossed up outside off, Haddin leans out and drives past the bowler for a single
Utseya to Haddin, no run tossed up on middle and leg, worked with the spin through midwicket.
Utseya to Haddin, no run on off stump this time, Haddin works it back towards the bowler
Utseya to Haddin, no run flat and fast on off stump, Haddin hangs back and defends to mid on
Utseya to Haddin, no run tossed up slowly, Haddin reaches across and works it with the spin to midwicket
Utseya to Haddin, no run back of a length this time, Haddin hangs back and defends down the track
Utseya to Haddin, no run and again, Utseya gets his second maiden in, haddin stays in the crease and defends
Cremer to Watson, 1 run tossed up leggie on leg stump, driven past the bowler to long on for one
Cremer to Haddin, no run again, tossed up and driven down the track, hits the stumps at the bowler's end. Doesn't touch the bowler's hand and Watson was in, in any case
Cremer to Haddin, no run nice stuff, the flat delivery that goes on without spinning. Skids into the pads of Haddin, surprised as he is caught on the crease
Cremer to Haddin, 1 run slower through the air on leg stump, this time he gets the single by flicking through square leg
Cremer to Watson, 1 wide lands this too far down the leg side, and since he isn't Warne, it doesn't rip out and hit the stumps. The batsman facing isn't Gatting either. Wide called.
Cremer to Watson, 1 run again on leg stump, Watson works it square for another single
Cremer to Haddin, no run back of a length on leg stump, defended down the track.
Utseya to Watson, no run tossed up on off, Watto reaches out and smothers the spin
Utseya to Watson, no run short of a length, Watto pounces on the back foot and cuts, but can't find the gap
Utseya to Watson, no run again Watto tries to stay back and work through the off side but can't get it away
Utseya to Watson, 1 run what's that, an arm ball? Surely went the other way, but that was too short to trouble Watto who punches into the off side

Utseya to Haddin, OUT Zimbabwe's first ever referral now. Utseya lands this back of a length outside off and it comes in gently with the angle, and then sharply with the spin. Haddin looks to work it through square leg, casually off the back foot, and is hit in front of middle. It was hitting middle a
Utseya to Ponting, no run another overspinner from Utseya, holds its line on off stump, and Ponting cautiously plays it to the leg side
Cremer to Watson, 2 leg byes Cremer lands this outside the leg stump and he deflects it fine. Two extras
Cremer to Watson, no run full and straight, on middle stump, Watto doesn't have to reach out to smother this one
Cremer to Watson, no run Watto presses forward gets to the spin and plays through the leg side
Cremer to Watson, no run compacto Watto. Full on middle and leg, he just gets evertything behind it and defends
Cremer to Watson, 1 run Watto gets a single this time, through the leg side and Ponting has strike
Cremer to Ponting, 1 run Ponting is away, full on leg stump, driven through wide mid on for one
Utseya to Ponting, no run half shout! Ponting almost does a Haddin, but think he got bat on this before it hit the pads as he played back to an offie. Hmm.
Utseya to Ponting, 1 run full delivery outside off, Pontind drives through the covers for one
Utseya to Watson, no run Watto tries to whip with the spin through midwicket, but can't get it away
Utseya to Watson, 1 run flatter, Watto plays back and forces it through wide mid on for one
Utseya to Ponting, 1 run Ponting gets a single this time, hanging on the crease, using the wrists and working it through midwicket
Utseya to Watson, 1 run turning down the leg side, Haddin works it squarer this time for one
Cremer to Watson, 1 run aired up by Cremer, on the pads, on driven through mid on for a single
Cremer to Ponting, 1 run tossed up on off and driven into the covers for one
Cremer to Watson, no run slows it up through the air, Watto leans out and defends solidly. If I had a dime each time that was done today.
Cremer to Watson, no run tossed up on middle and off, Watto defends again.
Cremer to Watson, no run yes you guessed right. Forward defensive again.
Cremer to Watson, 1 run tossed up outside off, driven into the covers for one more
Utseya to Watson, 1 run Utseya throws it up on off stump, driven down to long on for one
Utseya to Ponting, no run Price at point, prancing and prowling. Ponting can't get the single away as he steers backward of point
Utseya to Ponting, no run defends into the off side this time.
Utseya to Ponting, 1 run Ponting gets a single away down the ground. Over to Watto

Utseya to Watson, FOUR runs Watto has hit four. Stop the press. Cherish the moment. Short ball from Utseya, how rare is that? Watto swat-pulls down the ground for four. Rafael Nadal would have been proud of the shot.
Utseya to Watson, 1 run another short one, Watto doesn't get enough power behind it this time, and gets a single down the ground
Cremer to Watson, 1 run Watson gets a single away, staying back and playing with the spin
Cremer to Ponting, no run extra spin from Cremer, Pontin looks to get forward and defend and it runs away off the outside half backward of square

Cremer to Ponting, 1 run Ponting goes over the top and almost holes out. Tossed up outside off and Ponting looks to play the inside out extra cover drive. It almost carries to Chakabva patrolling the extra cover fence.
Cremer to Watson, 1 run Watson hangs deep in the crease and works it behind square for a single
Cremer to Ponting, 3 runs delicate from Ponting, gets his front foot inside the line and deflects a ball straying down the leg side down to fine leg for three
Cremer to Watson, 1 run Watson stays back and forces a delivery outside off stump down to long on for a single
Taylor to Watson, 1 run turning in from a length, outside off, swatted down the ground for a single
Taylor to Ponting, 2 runs nice placement from Ponting, stays back to a short of length ball that did not offer much width for the cut, but he guided it expertly into the covers for a couple

Taylor to Ponting, 3 runs Ponting's class could break the shackles here. He stays back, waits for the ball to turn in and runs it almost out of Taibu's gloves down to third man. You need pedigree to play these shots.
Taylor to Watson, 1 run fuller length on off stump, Watson reaches out and drives through mid off for one more
Taylor to Ponting, 1 run Ponting forces him with the spin, off the back foot through midwicket

Taylor to Watson, FOUR runs Watson enters the nervous 50s. Stays back to a shockingly short ball outside off and sends it packing through the covers. Nicely played, and it's crucial that he keeps going
Cremer to Ponting, no run tossed up on off stump, Ponting presses forward and drives through wide mid off for a single
Cremer to Ponting, no run flightded on middle and off, he reaches out and plays defensively
Cremer to Ponting, no run another flighted offering on the stumps, Ponting tries to force it away through the leg side, but can't get it away
Cremer to Ponting, no run another dot, Ponting looks to sweep and misses as it slides down onto the pads. Four dots on the trot
Cremer to Ponting, 1 run finally Ponting gets a single away, working against the spin through the leg side
Cremer to Watson, no run Watson comes forward to another slow loopy delivery on leg stump and defends down the track
Chigumbura to Ponting, 1 wide slips the first ball down the leg
Chigumbura to Ponting, 1 run angled into the pads, too easy for Ponting who clips it through midwicket for one
Chigumbura to Watson, no run better line, on off stump, Watto defends into the covers.
Chigumbura to Watson, FOUR runs lovely touch from Watto. Again Elton dangles this one on the pads and Watto gets the front foot across and clips it daintily through square leg for four.

Chigumbura to Watson, 1 run another one on the pads, Watto flicks behind square for one. Zim need to be careful here, they shouldn't let Watto get out of the nervous 50s too soon. Surely they know how many times he's been out in the 50s?
Chigumbura to Ponting, 1 run Ponting drives crisply through mid off for one, full length ball and an easy single
Chigumbura to Watson, no run full delivery outside off, Watson plays the square drive, uppishly but short of the man at point.
Cremer to Ponting, 1 run Ponting gets forward to a full delivery on middle and off, punches it down to long on for a single
Cremer to Watson, no run this one turns away from Watto, who adjusts his forward defensive and plays it away off the outside half
Cremer to Watson, 1 run air again from Cremer, Watto punches with the full face of the bat through wide long on for another single

Cremer to Ponting, 3 runs almost fooled Cremer down the leg side. Ponting was advancing, Cremer saw him coming and tried to get a leg side stumping, Ponting adjusted and managed to get a tickle down the leg side. Close

Cremer to Watson, SIX runs Watto has gone past the nervous 50s in majestic style. Primal violence in that pull, Cremer fed him a gentle half tracker and Watto tried to smash it from the West of India to the East. he got as far as the stands at deep midwicket. Went down on as knee and brutalised it. Bo
Cremer to Watson, 1 run and he gets a single to retain strike, in front of square
Chigumbura to Watson, 1 run over-pitched on leg stumo, Watto drills it down the ground for one
Chigumbura to Ponting, 1 run back of a length outside off, Ponting punches into the covers for another single
Chigumbura to Watson, 1 run Watson this time, drives easily through the off side for a single
Chigumbura to Ponting, 1 run Elton holds the length back, Ponting still comes forward, covers the line and drives down the ground with a straight bat. Singles easily available now.
Chigumbura to Watson, 2 runs Zimbabwe are releasing the stranglehold now. Another gentle delivery on the pads, Watto happily glances it square for a couple as Coventry comes around to save it

Chigumbura to Watson, FOUR runs the captain has let his side down here. Another dolly on the toes, Watson twinkles away inside the line and helps it along with better timing, backward of square. Coventry can't do much and it is four more
Cremer to Ponting, 1 run Ponting skips out, gets to the pitch and clips in down the ground for a single
Cremer to Watson, 1 run Watson hangs back in the crease and punches through wide mid on for another single
Cremer to Ponting, 1 run different strokes for different folks. While Watto hangs back by default, Ponting keeps skipping out of the crease. He drives through mid off this time for another single
Cremer to Watson, no run nice work from Cremer, Watto looks to force him away through the off side, but he jumps across and fields
Cremer to Watson, no run Watson leans out and defends as a delivery turns away from him sharply
Cremer to Watson, 1 run ends the over with a single, driving fluently into the covers
Williams to Watson, FOUR runs he begins with a horribly short delivery straying down the leg side, Watto happily pulls it away behind square. Part-time problems for Zim.
Williams to Watson, no run better, gets some drift this time and Watto has to cover the line and defend
Williams to Watson, 1 run
Williams to Ponting, 1 run Pontins gets inside the line and works a single through midwicket
Williams to Watson, 1 run another short ball, Watto will feel aggrieved he did not get four for it. Hits the leather off the ball as he pulls powerfully to the man in the deep
Williams to Ponting, no run Ponting comes forward and defends the last ball with the spin into the covers
Cremer to Watson, no run tossed up on off, Watto gets forward and blocks

Cremer to Watson, OUT huge appeal for lbw, turned down. Will they refer it? Yes, they will. Tossed up on middle and off and fizzing along straight, off the track. Watto was well forward, but the replays suggest that was crashing into middle and off, three-fourths of the way up. No evidence that it hit
Cremer to Clarke, 1 run played off the pads towards deep square leg
Cremer to Ponting, no run Ponting gets behind the line on the back foot and defends to the bowler
Cremer to Ponting, no run played off the back foot towards the off side
Cremer to Ponting, no run played towards cover once again
Williams to Clarke, 1 run played through midwicket off the front foot
Williams to Ponting, no run Ponting comes forward and plays to midwicket but can't find the gap
Williams to Ponting, no run Ponting comes forward once again and defends with bat and pad close together
Williams to Ponting, 1 run defended on the front foot

Williams to Clarke, 1 run, OUT Ponting's run out by a splendid direct hit from deep midwicket. Clarke came forward to take the ball on the full and flicked it to deep midwicket. The batsmen wanted the second and had Mpofu's throw from the deep not hit the stumps directly at the non-striker's end, they
Williams to Clarke, 1 run played towards deep square leg for one more
Cremer to Clarke, 1 run Clarke comes forward once again and drives to long on for a single
Cremer to White, no run Cremer bowls a tight line and White defends on the front foot
Cremer to White, 1 run drifts on to leg stump this time and White nudges it around the corner
Cremer to Clarke, 2 runs Clarke waits late for one outside off stump and cuts deftly, Mpofu fields and throws superbly on the boundary once again
Cremer to Clarke, 1 run played behind square for a single
Cremer to White, no run tossed up on middle stump, played back to the bowler
Williams to Clarke, 1 run slightly shorter in length and the batsman plays the ball behind square
Williams to White, no run defended towards the bowler from the crease
Williams to White, no run short ball and White could have hit that anywhere on the off side. He chose the fielder at cover
Williams to White, no run White tries to reverse sweep and fails to connect
Williams to White, 1 run driven to long-on for a single
Williams to Clarke, 1 run Clarke stays in his crease and flicks the ball off his pads through square leg
Cremer to Clarke, no run Cremer hits the pad with a straighter one as Clarke plays off the back foot but the impact was such that the ball would have missed leg stump
Cremer to Clarke, no run Clarke comes forward and drives the ball hard towards the bowler
Cremer to Clarke, 1 run a skiddy delivery and Clarke rocks back and pulls to deep square
Cremer to White, no run a wayward slog from White, tried to cart it from wide outside off against the spin towards the leg side, he missed
Cremer to White, 1 run White drives the ball firmly just wide of a diving Cremer towards long off
Cremer to Clarke, no run played forcefully towards long-on for a single
Williams to White, no run defended watchfully towards the bowler
Williams to White, no run played back towards the bowler once again
Williams to White, 1 run shorter in length and this time White drives it past the bowler
Williams to Clarke, 1 run Clarke strides forward and drives fluently towards long-on
Williams to White, 1 run pushed wide of the bowler on the off side for a single
Williams to Clarke, no run Clarke tries to work the ball on the leg side but fails to make contact this time
Taylor to White, 1 run another push towards long-on for another single. Australia have the batting Powerplay left to take.
Taylor to Clarke, 1 run played towards the off side this time
Taylor to White, 1 run pushed through square leg
Taylor to Clarke, 1 run tossed up and Clarke gets forward to the pitch of the ball and drives to long-on
Taylor to White, no run played back to the bowler on the front foot
Taylor to White, 1 run forced towards long-on once again for a single to end the 38th over
Williams to White, no run forced off the back foot but it's hit towards the bowler
Williams to White, 1 run this time it's wide of the bowler and they run a single to long-off
Williams to Clarke, no run defended on the front foot towards the leg side
Williams to Clarke, no run played towards mid-on but midwicket cuts it off
Williams to Clarke, 1 run eased off the back foot towards long-off for a single. It's the only run-scoring zone at the moment - long on and off.
Williams to White, 1 run and again, another single towards long-off
Taylor to White, 1 run comes down the track and drives towards long-on once again
Taylor to Clarke, 1 run another delivery payed down the ground
Taylor to White, 1 run this time it's worked through square leg for a single
Taylor to Clarke, 2 runs width offered outside off and Clarke cuts it in a flash towards the third man boundary. Mpofu picks it up just inside the boundary and sends a rocket of a throw towards Taibu
Taylor to Clarke, 1 run played through square for a single
Taylor to White, no run quicker ball and the line is pretty straight, played back to the bowler on the back foot
Mpofu to Clarke, 4 leg byes Clarke tries to make room at first and then gets inside the line as Mpofu strays down leg side. Clarke glances the ball off his hips past short fine leg
Mpofu to Clarke, 1 wide short ball down leg side, he will have to re-bowl that.

Mpofu to Clarke, 1 run follows Clarke with a full ball as the batsman makes room to hit over the over side. All the fielders are in the circle on the off side. Clarke can only work it through the leg side this time
Mpofu to White, 1 run White makes a bit of room and biffs the ball down the ground towards long on
Mpofu to Clarke, 1 wide full ball down leg side. Mpofu needs to keep it together here.
Mpofu to Clarke, no run the slower ball and the batsman mis-times it back to the bowler after trying to make room to hit over the off
Mpofu to Clarke, 1 run another slower ball played behind square

Mpofu to White, OUT bowled him! White needed to go for it, and he picked a slower ball to try and hit through midwicket. He was early on the shot and the ball cannoned into middle and leg stump off the bottom edge.
Williams to Clarke, no run lovely delivery on middle stump, no pace to work with on a tight length. Clarke goes back and forces it to cover
Williams to Clarke, 1 run driven down the ground for a single
Williams to Hussey, 1 run Hussey goes right back and drives the ball from middle stump through cover point
Williams to Clarke, 1 run Clarke moves quickly on to the back foot and cuts hard but can't find the gap on the deep point boundary
Williams to Hussey, SIX runs that is some shot for a second delivery! Hussey gets under the ball and sends it high and far over the bowler's head. Did that clear the sight screen?
Williams to Hussey, no run played back to the bowler
Utseya to Clarke, 1 run comes down the track to flick but gets a leading edge towards mid-off
Utseya to White, 1 run full length and White nudges the ball off his boots
Utseya to Clarke, FOUR runs short ball and Clarke sends it racing to the deep square boundary with a fierce pull off the back foot
Utseya to Clarke, 1 run driven towards long-on for a single
Utseya to White, 1 run played towards deep midwicket for a single
Utseya to Clarke, no run flatter and shorter, nudged off the front foot towards midwicket
Price to White, 1 run pushed off the back foot towards long-on for a single
Price to Clarke, 1 run played towards deep midwicket for one more
Price to White, no run White steps out but then has to defend towards midwicket because he is beaten by the length

Price to White, 2 runs Ervine had a extremely tough chance at deep midwicket but couldn't take it. White came at Price and lofted the ball towards deep midwicket. Ervine came running off the boundary and dived forward at full stretch. He just got hands to it but couldn't hold on.
Price to White, 1 run
Price to Clarke, 1 run played down the ground towards long on
Utseya to Clarke, no run forced off the back foot towards cover
Utseya to Clarke, 1 run worked off the pads towards deep square leg
Utseya to Hussey, 1 wide fired down leg side
Utseya to Hussey, FOUR runs comes down the track and plays the most awesome cover drive on the move. He's timed and placed it well enough to beat the fielder on the extra-cover boundary
Utseya to Hussey, 1 run played down the ground for one more
Utseya to Clarke, 1 wide fired down leg side once again, another wide
Utseya to Clarke, 1 run Clarke makes room to drive a full ball through cover point
Utseya to Hussey, 1 run Hussey comes forward and drives the ball off his legs towards wide long-on
Mpofu to Hussey, 1 run driven firmly but down the ground to long on where the boundaries are protected
Mpofu to Clarke, 2 runs Clarke walks across his crease and flicks the ball off his pads through midwicket
Mpofu to Clarke, 2 runs short ball and Clarke plays the pull towards wide long on where the fielder slips after collecting the ball, ensuring that the second run is risk free
Mpofu to Clarke, FOUR runs terrible ball, full and down leg side, Clarke gets some bat on it to place it wide of a diving Taibu

Mpofu to Clarke, 2 runs good length ball outside off, Clarke works it through midwicket and has hit it gently enough to complete the second as the fielder from the deep reaches the ball. That's his half-century too.
Mpofu to Clarke, FOUR runs expensive over from Zimbabwe. Clarke finishes it by making room to loft a length ball over extra cover. Australia should get 250 now
Utseya to Clarke, 1 run full toss and the batsman pulls hard to Mpofu on the deep square leg boundary. They aren't taking chances against his arm
Utseya to White, no run fired in full and fast outside off stump, White plays it back to the bowler
Utseya to White, 1 run this time he manages to place it wide of the bowler and collects a single towards long-on
Utseya to Clarke, FOUR runs shot, Clarke skips down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball, and lofts cleanly through the line, hitting the ball straight down the ground
Utseya to Clarke, 1 run shorter ball and Clarke waits in his crease before playing a chippy pull in the air towards deep square leg
Utseya to White, 1 run White drives the ball with lots of bottom hand, hitting in flat towards long-off. It reaches the fielder after bouncing once.
Price to White, 1 run played towards long off once again, along the ground this time
Price to Clarke, no run Clarke went back to pull but the length wasn't that short and the ball hurried on to him. He missed and got struck on the body.
Price to Clarke, 1 run played towards deep square leg for a single
Price to White, 1 leg bye flat and down leg side. White attempts to paddle it past short fine leg but gets hit on the pad
Price to Clarke, no run Price fires the ball in at leg stump once again. Clarke can't make contact
Price to Clarke, 1 run Clarke goes back and nudges the ball through square

Price to Hussey, OUT and that's why! Bowled him! Hussey charges down the track and aims for the heave down the ground. Price drags it shorter, bowls it quicker and keeps it dead straight. Hussey misses by a long way, and Price hits the stumps.
Price to Smith, FOUR runs and perhaps this is why. Smith backs away to a flat ball and flat-bats it hard down the ground. He's placed it straight enough to beat long-off
Price to Smith, SIX runs Smith brings up 250 with a superbly executed slow-sweep that sails high and far over deep backward square leg
Price to Smith, 1 run played towards deep point for a single
Price to Clarke, no run dabbed towards short third man
Price to Clarke, 2 runs Clarke steps forward and drives towards long-on for a single. Sloppy cricket from Zimbabwe as they concede an over throw

Mpofu to Smith, OUT Mpofu is very, very lucky. He bowled a rubbish ball, a full toss on leg stump. Smith could have smashed it, anywhere. Instead he sort of chipped it off his pads and straight to the fielder on the deep square leg boundary.
Mpofu to Clarke, no run excellent ball to follow up, a yorker in the blockhole. Clarke digs it out. Such is life. A rubbish ball gets a wicket, an excellent one doesn't.
Mpofu to Clarke, 1 run another full and straight ball, Clarke swings it towards long-on for one
Mpofu to Johnson, 2 runs a low full toss outside off stump. Driven powerfully towards long off where a fumble from Coventry allows the second

Mpofu to Johnson, FOUR runs Johnson lifts the ball with the angle into him and places it into the gap on the deep square leg boundary. That's his zone and Mpofu needs to keep away from it. Full outside off is the way to go.
Mpofu to Johnson, 1 run full toss outside off stump, Johnson swings hard and hits it down the ground towards long on.
We'll be back in about 40 minutes for the Zimbabwe chase.
If you want to follow and support your team on Facebook, click here.

17.41: Zimbabwe have done all they could to keep Australia to a manageable target and it's been a commendable effort. Their spinners were exceptional. Elton Chigumbura said at the toss that they were hoping to keep Australia below 270. Well they've done that. Now their batsmen have to handle the searing pace
Taylor and Coventry are opening Zimbabwe's chase. Don't see too many batsmen wearing spectacles these days, but Coventry does. Shaun Tait has the new ball and is at the start of his massive run-up.
"Could this be the first upset? Would be great in world cup context but I don't see Zim escaping the Aussie pace onslaught," says David.
All I want is a good game. Meanwhile, we have some new apps on the block. For iPhone and Android.
Tait to Taylor, 1 run 144kmh, short of a length and straight. Taylor stands tall on the back foot, dabs it towards the off side with soft hands, and calls for the quick single
Tait to Coventry, 1 wide full and fast but the line is down leg side. Tait doesn't want to be running that long run-up more times than necessary in Indian conditions
Tait to Coventry, no run short ball this time, outside off stump, Coventry lets it go through to Haddin
Tait to Coventry, no run good length ball at 143.6 kph outside off stump. Coventry lets it go again
Tait to Coventry, no run Coventry goes dangerously on to the back foot to a fullish ball that is very straight and defends
Tait to Coventry, no run Tait grunts as he lets one rip at 145 kph, the length is short and the line is outside off. Coventry shoulders arms
Tait to Coventry, no run full and wide and Coventry throws his bat at it, aiming to carve it through the point region. Doesn't make contact
Lee to Taylor, 1 run full ball angling into the right-hander. Taylor works the ball off his pads towards deep square
Lee to Coventry, FOUR runs shot. Coventry leans into a half-volley outside off stump and sends it racing to the cover boundary with a powerful yet graceful drive
Lee to Coventry, no run Coventry gets behind the line of a good length ball and defends on the off side. He doesn't move around much in his crease
Lee to Coventry, no run good length and very straight from Lee. Coventry opens the face and plays the ball towards point
Lee to Coventry, no run Coventry jumps back to play a short of a length ball and fends it awkwardly, taking his bottom hand off the bat
Lee to Coventry, no run short of a length and the line is wider outside off stump, Coventry punches off the back foot towards point
Tait to Taylor, 2 runs short of a length ball angling into the right-hander, Taylor moves back and across and nudges the ball off his hips towards long leg
Tait to Taylor, no run full ball at 148 kph outside off stump, Taylor takes a small step forward and blocks towards cover
Tait to Taylor, no run Tait tests Taylor with a bouncer at 145 kph. Taylor sways out of the way and hears the ball whizz past
Tait to Taylor, 1 wide his hearing needs to be exceptional to hear this one, it is extremely wide outside off

Tait to Taylor, 1 run punched off the back foot towards extra cover. More of ball hitting bat than the other way around. He sets off for a single and is home before Ponting's direct hit at the non-striker's end.
Tait to Coventry, 2 runs Coventry gets on to the back foot and punches a shorter ball through the gap at cover point
Tait to Coventry, no run Coventry jumps back to defend a good length ball and wants one. Taylor doesn't
Lee to Taylor, no run full and straight at 137 kph, Taylor gets behind the line and defends
Lee to Taylor, 1 run short ball directed at the body. Taylor moves back and across just enough to work the ball behind square
Lee to Coventry, no run short of a length outside off stump, Coventry barely moves as he lifts his bat out of the way

Lee to Coventry, SIX runs that is one of the flattest sixes you'll see! Coventry laid into a length ball outside off and played the square drive with immense power. The ball rocketed off the bat and flew over the point boundary. It carried about ten feet over the boundary and smashed into the wall.
Lee to Coventry, 1 run fuller length and straighter line, flicked off the pads through square leg
Lee to Taylor, no run left alone outside off stump
Johnson to Coventry, no run hits a good length with his first ball and is very straight. Coventry defends from his crease on the off side
Johnson to Coventry, no run again there's almost no movement from Coventry. He waits motionless until the ball reaches him and then moves just enough to defend on the off side.
Johnson to Coventry, no run played off the back foot towards point
Johnson to Coventry, no run Johnson pins Coventry on the back foot with a good length delivery. 141.6 kph. Coventry nudges the ball towards the leg side and Johnson runs across to field
Johnson to Coventry, 1 run a bit too straight this time from Johnson and Coventry turns the ball off his pads towards fine leg
Johnson to Taylor, no run played off the back foot towards cover point
Lee to Coventry, no run short of a length ball from Lee gets big on Coventry who defends on the leg side. He looks awkward while playing the short ball off the back foot
Lee to Coventry, no run Coventry attempts to play the pull but was in no control whatsoever. Lee beats him with the short ball
Lee to Coventry, no run defended from the crease towards the off side

Lee to Coventry, OUT this was a likely dismissal. Coventry was edgy against the short ball and tried to pull this one from outside off stump. The top edge swirled high in the air and the ball descended in the region of silly mid-off, where Lee was waiting to take the caught and bowled
Lee to Taibu, no run short of a length and very straight. Taibu opens the face and plays towards point
Lee to Taibu, no run a full ball swings into the right-hander, Taibu plays the drive towards the bowler
Johnson to Taylor, 1 run Johnson pitches outside leg and Taylor nudges the ball off his pads towards fine leg
Johnson to Taibu, no run full and straight, Taibu stays firm in his crease and plays towards cover
Johnson to Taibu, no run no room to work with and Taibu's attempt to steer towards third man finds backward point
Johnson to Taibu, no run a superb short ball, very straight and intended to hit the body. Taibu does well to watch the ball and sway out of the way
Johnson to Taibu, no run the full one follows the short one. Taibu pushes from his crease towards cover point
Johnson to Taibu, 1 run worked off the pads towards midwicket
Lee to Taibu, 1 run short of a length just outside off stump, Taibu slashes it in the air towards third man
Lee to Taylor, FOUR runs terrific shot, Taylor waits for the short of a length ball outside off and then chips it deftly over the head of the fielder at first slip. He played that so late
Lee to Taylor, no run short of a length again outside off stump. This one doesn't rise as much so Taylor lets it go
Lee to Taylor, no run good length with a hint of swing into the right-hander, Taylor defends from his crease
Lee to Taylor, 1 run a full ball this time and there's swing into Taylor who mis-times the push towards cover
Lee to Taibu, no run Taibu plays a crisp square drive off the back foot that nearly pierces the infield. Steve Smith flings himself to his right at point and pulls off a tremendous save
Johnson to Taylor, 1 run Taylor pushes the ball towards mid-on where Tait, who is perhaps Australia's slowest mover, can't prevent the single
Johnson to Taibu, 1 run Taibu plays a flashy drive at a good length ball angling across him and edges towards third man
Johnson to Taylor, no run Taylor gets behind the line and defends on the off side
Johnson to Taylor, no run Johnson speeds a good length delivery past the outside edge of Taylor's forward defence
Johnson to Taylor, no run defended solidly off the front foot towards cover
Johnson to Taylor, 2 runs short of a length on leg and middle, Taylor works the ball off his body through the leg side, there's a direct hit from Hussey as Taylor returns for the second but he's safe
Lee to Taibu, no run Lee pitches on a perfect length on off stump. Taibu defends from his crease towards cover
Lee to Taibu, no run a touch fuller and Taibu has a real go at a ball he could have put away. The placement of the square drive however isn't good and he hits it to the man at point
Lee to Taibu, no run slower ball and Taibu plays another drive on the off side
Lee to Taibu, no run Lee was looking for the yorker and bowled a low and fast full toss. Taibu brings his bat down in time to keep it out
Lee to Taibu, 1 wide shorter ball and the line is slanting down leg side. Taibu misses the swivel-pull but that's wide
Lee to Taibu, FOUR runs he's placed this! Taibu stands in his crease and slaps a length delivery with power through cover. No feet movement, but excellent timing.
Lee to Taibu, no run Lee responds with a slower bouncer. Taibu is far too early with his pull shot and gets beaten
Johnson to Taylor, no run good length and very straight. Taylor defends towards the bowler

Johnson to Taylor, 1 run good length ball and Taylor pushes towards mid-off and takes on Ponting's arm. He doesn't have to worry though but Taibu does. Ponting reaches the ball in a flash and throws at the batsman's end. Taibu dives full length but the throw misses

Johnson to Taibu, OUT he's given Watson some catching practice at first slip. Taibu tried to guide the ball towards third man by opening the face but the line of the short of a length ball was far too close to the body. He ended up steering it off the face towards Watson's right. He bent swiftly to ta
Johnson to Ervine, no run left alone outside off stump
Johnson to Ervine, no run Ervine pushes forward at a good length ball that straightens off the pitch and gets beaten outside off. He was a bit late on that shot
Johnson to Ervine, no run defended on the front foot towards point
Tait to Taylor, no run defended on the front foot towards midwicket

Tait to Taylor, OUT bowled him! Taylor tried to work the ball on the leg side from his crease and closed the face of the bat. He missed and Tait sped the ball through and grazed the pad before uprooting middle stump. Nothing special, just straight, fast and very effective.
Tait to Chigumbura, 4 leg byes full ball on leg stump, Chigumbura gets a bit of pad on the ball and gets a boundary towards fine leg
Tait to Chigumbura, no run defended from the crease towards the off
Tait to Chigumbura, no run good length ball outside off stump, Chigumbura lets it go
Tait to Chigumbura, no run short ball at the body, Chigumbura ducks under it
Johnson to Ervine, no run good length ball outside off stump, pushed off the front foot towards cover point
Johnson to Ervine, no run he's been hit, Ervine lost sight of that short ball and wore it on the grill of the helmet

Johnson to Ervine, OUT Johnson bowls a full, fast and straight ball that thuds into Ervine's pads as he tries to play across the line and falls over a touch. Johnson roars an appeal but Asoka de Silva is unmoved, again. Haddin is adamant that it should be reviewed. Replays show that it's pretty plumb.
Johnson to Williams, no run another full and straight ball that hits the pad. Johnson appeals but not as convincingly this time. It might have been missing leg so there's no review.
Johnson to Williams, no run Johnson hits the pad again as Williams tries to work the ball on the leg side. Missing leg again.
Johnson to Williams, no run defended on the off side on the front foot
Tait to Chigumbura, FOUR runs Tait strays towards leg again and Chigumbura glances it past a diving Haddin for four towards fine leg
Tait to Chigumbura, 2 leg byes another full ball down leg side, this time there's pad on the ball and Haddin gets some glove on it and slows the pace as it heads towards fine leg
Tait to Chigumbura, no run defended on the front foot towards the off side
Tait to Chigumbura, no run short of a length ball, Chigumbura defends on the leg side
Tait to Chigumbura, no run full length on leg stump, this time Chigumbura can't get the leg glance right and the ball hits his pad
Tait to Chigumbura, FOUR runs Tait gives Chigumbura some space outside off and he drives a length delivery through extra cover with excellent timing
Johnson to Williams, no run Johnson ambles in and targets his short balls at the batsman's body. Willaims ducks right under it
Johnson to Williams, 3 runs Williams stays steady in his crease and plays the square drive through the gap at cover point. Clarke gives chase
Johnson to Chigumbura, no run Chigumbura gets behind the line of a good length delivery on off and middle and defends with a straight bat towards the bowler
Johnson to Chigumbura, no run the line is on leg stump and the length a touch shorter. Chigumbura tries to glance the ball off his hips but doesn't make proper contact
Johnson to Chigumbura, no run defended towards square leg from the crease
Johnson to Chigumbura, no run Chigumbura chases one that slants across him from over the wicket. The length was there for the drive and Chigumbura went for it and was beaten.

Krejza to Williams, FOUR runs and the outside edge straight away. Nice flight and spin, it breaks away from Williams who feels for it without getting entirely across, it eludes slip and runs away for four
Krejza to Williams, no run straighter, Williams reaches out and smothers the spin
Krejza to Williams, 2 runs another edge, this can be frustrating. Williams reaches out and drives without full conviction, and it squeezes away to the right of backward point
Krejza to Williams, no run a touch of drift and turn away from off stump, Williams leaves
Krejza to Williams, no run over-pitched on off, Williams drives straight to mid off
Krejza to Williams, no run flatter and on the pads, Williams looks to flick and misses
Watson to Chigumbura, no run back of a length and coming in with the angle, defended to the off side of the pitch
Watson to Chigumbura, 1 run on the pads this time, looks to flick and gets some bat and pad on it away through square leg for a single
Watson to Williams, no run back of a length and angling across Williams who defends to the off side off the back foot
Watson to Williams, no run similar ball, a touch fuller, similar response from Williams who defends to the off side
Watson to Williams, no run very full, on the stumps and this time Williams plays through mid on. Not much feet movement, and Sunny Gavaskar doesn't quite appreciate it, on air.
Watson to Williams, no run good start from Watto, Williams opens the face and steers from outside off towards backward point
Krejza to Chigumbura, no run Krejza drifts in outside off, draws Elton out and he can't get to the pitch and defends to the off side
Krejza to Chigumbura, 1 run again skips out, this time he gets to the pitch and works it wide of mid on for a single
Krejza to Williams, no run Williams continues to defend as Krejza tosses it up
Krejza to Williams, SIX runs who, where did that come from? Williams has seen enough of Krejza's flight, plonks the front foot down the track and swings him majestically over deep midwicket. Ka-boom.
Krejza to Williams, no run good response from Krejza, extra turn from middle and off line as Williams leans out, it goes off the outside half towards point
Krejza to Williams, 1 run gets closer to the pitch and drives along the ground through mid off for one
Watson to Williams, no run Williams hangs back and defends to the off side as Watto angles another one innocously across him
Watson to Williams, 1 run back of a length and on the stumps, Williams flicks in front of square for one more
Watson to Chigumbura, no run Elton looks to boom the cover drive away and gets an inside edge as Watto comes on slowly from back of a length.
Watson to Chigumbura, 1 run faster and fuller, Elton motions into the off drive, plays is straight to Ponting at mid off, who fumbles and makes the single easy
Watson to Williams, no run full length on middle and leg, Williams looks to flick and gets a leading edge,
Watson to Williams, 1 run Williams retains strike with a push into the covers. It is all very quiet at the moment as the Required rate crosses 6.
Krejza to Williams, no run prodigious spin from Krejza, drifts into off stump line and then breaks away viciously past the attempted cut. Hmm.
Krejza to Williams, 1 run and now one that stays low, Williams gets bat on the cut and picks a single in front of cover point

Krejza to Chigumbura, 3 runs well played Elton, plays the field to perfection. Tossed up and turning into him from outside off, Elton knew there was a gap at deep extra cover and decided to drive against the spin in the air. Almost went all the way too.
Krejza to Williams, 1 run Williams rocks back and cuts despite not having much room, and gets a single to deep point
Krejza to Chigumbura, no run turns in nicely from outside off, and Elton defends

Krejza to Chigumbura, 4 byes well, the spin is in. Krejza does a Murali as this breaks in from outside off, changing course as if it is drunk. It beats Elton's drive, beats Haddin, beats everything and goes for four. Big bounce too, took it over the stumps.
Watson to Williams, no run back of a length and angling across, Watto will do this all day. Williams defends from the crease
Watson to Williams, no run fuller on middle and off, Williams gets half forward and defends compactly
Watson to Williams, 2 runs nicely done, back of a length on the pads, Williams controls the whip and redirects it towards deep midwicket for a couple
Watson to Williams, no run over-pitched outside off, Williams leans into the drive and gets it out to cover inside the circle
Watson to Williams, 1 run on the pads, Williams works it off the backfoot towards midwicket
Watson to Chigumbura, no run effort ball to end the over, Elton had to weave away from it as it went through just outside off
Krejza to Williams, 1 run short of a length and straightening from outside off, cut away through cover point for one

Krejza to Chigumbura, OUT Elton's gone. Krejza throws this up well outside off and he goes for the lap-sweep. Too ambitious, he had to bring that around from a long way off, and ended up getting gloving a top edge that popped up on the off side. Haddin runs across and pouches it, then hurries back to
Krejza to Chakabva, no run again some big turn from outside off as Regis tries to play through the off side
Krejza to Chakabva, no run
Krejza to Chakabva, no run thrown up well wide outside off and he lets it go. Almost a wide

Krejza to Chakabva, no run aha, the ball is stopping on him. Regis tries to go back to a short ball and work it to the leg side with the spin. Ends up playing it too early and almost pops a return catch
Tait to Williams, no run fires it in full and from wide of the crease, at 137 kph, Williams hangs in the crease and steers to point
Tait to Williams, 2 runs width from Tait, Williams does the smart thing, uses the pace and slaps it backward of square. Sweeper cover runs across and keeps it down to two
Tait to Williams, 1 run full pitched on middle and leg, Williams gets behind the line and defends to the off side
Tait to Chakabva, 1 run 137 kph, he's looking for the yorker, but this one is on the pads and is clipped through square leg for one
Tait to Williams, no run over-pitched wide of the crease, Williams jams the bat down on it and steers it square, but straight to the fielder
Tait to Williams, no run slightly shorter in length, still Williams looks to drive. He times it well, but straight to point
Krejza to Chakabva, no run flighted outside off and straightening, defended down the track by Regis.
Krejza to Chakabva, 1 run short of a length and turning down the leg, worked off the pads through square leg
Krejza to Williams, no run angled down the leg side, he goes for the sweep and plays it to short fine leg
Krejza to Williams, 1 run short ball, turning away from outside off and cut to deep backward point
Krejza to Chakabva, no run this one breaks in from outside off, defended off the backfoot to the off side
Krejza to Chakabva, 1 run tossed up outside off, he goes for the bent knee extra cover drive, with a wristy flourish and gets a single to the deep

Tait to Chakabva, no run that's what Tait does best, a Waqar Younisesque thunderbolt straight at the toes, and Regis has no clue where it went after hastily removing his feet from the danger area and stopping the irresistable force. What a yorker.
Tait to Chakabva, no run shortens the length this time, but doesn't reduce the pace, Regis slashes hard. At thin air.
Tait to Chakabva, no run and now the bouncer, some serious pace being worked up, Regis ducks
Tait to Chakabva, no run another short one at 138 kph outside off, Regis weaves out of harm's way
Tait to Chakabva, 1 run finally gets bat on ball, opens the face and guides it from outside off through backward point

Tait to Williams, OUT Tait's blown Williams away with 144.7 kph of unplayable pace. Almost a yorker again, from wide of the crease from round the wicket, homes the guided missile in on the line of off stump. Williams has played back to everything, think he'd make a good playback singer. He hangs deep
Krejza to Chakabva, 1 run
Krejza to Utseya, no run Utseya drives against the spin into the covers
Krejza to Utseya, no run tossed up outside off, driven thoughtfully into the covers
Krejza to Utseya, no run straightens from off stump, defended down the track
Krejza to Utseya, no run holds the length back and he defends down the track again
Krejza to Utseya, no run this one is turning down the leg and is worked off the pads to the leg side
Smith to Chakabva, 1 leg bye appeal for lbw, but it was drifting down the leg as he got pad on it, and a leg bye to square leg
Smith to Utseya, 2 runs short ball outside off, he waits for it and cuts backward of square for a couple
Smith to Utseya, no run fuller and straighter, defended to the on side of the pitch
Smith to Utseya, 1 run shorter outside off, Utseya cuts away in front of square for one
Smith to Chakabva, 1 run Regis picks a single by forcing a short ball through the covers
Smith to Utseya, 1 run another single in front of square to end the over
Krejza to Utseya, 1 run turns in from outside off, defended off the front foot down the track

Krejza to Chakabva, OUT Regis perishes to a strange shot, trying to pull a length ball tossed up around middle and leg. He may have played forward to it, he should have played with a straight bat. Instead, he stayed back and looked to pull. It gripped and straightened, whizzed past the bat and thudded
Krejza to Cremer, no run tossed up outside off, he leans out and smothers the spin.
Krejza to Cremer, 1 run turning down the leg side, Cremer works it behind square for a single

Krejza to Utseya, no run another huge lbw appeal as Krejza gets one to straighten from off stump, Prosper pushed forward to defend, but it broke back and hit the pad. Not challenged by Aus as umpire Kettleborough says not out
Krejza to Utseya, no run this one doesn't turn so much and Utseya gets bat on it
Smith to Cremer, no run flat delivery on off, steered off the back foot towards the off side
Smith to Cremer, no run huge appeal from Haddin, none from anyone else as Smith gets the topspinner going, Cremer jammed the bat down on it at the last moment, and it did not hit pad at all
Smith to Cremer, 1 run stays back and works this one off the pads through square leg for one
Smith to Utseya, no run strange shot, Utseya tries to be cheeky and lap it through short fine leg. Doesn't get it away.
Smith to Utseya, 1 run fuller and Utseya drives past cover for a single
Smith to Cremer, 2 runs Cremer plays the lap shot this time and gets it away for a couple too. Well played, against the spin, but in full control
Krejza to Utseya, no run tossed up from round the wicket and defended
Krejza to Utseya, no run again Utseya gets half forward and blocks down the track
Krejza to Utseya, no run shorter outside off, Utseya stays back and defends
Krejza to Utseya, 1 run quicker through the air, Utseya adjusts and drives firmly past mid on for a single
Krejza to Cremer, no run tossed up on middle and off, Cremer skips out to the pitch and works it through midwicket
Krejza to Cremer, 1 run this time he advances and gets to the pitch, drives down the ground for a single
Smith to Cremer, no run tossed up on off stump and defended with the spin to the off side
Smith to Cremer, 1 run this time he gets the single through the covers
Smith to Utseya, no run gets forward and feebly pushes into the covers.
Smith to Utseya, 1 run Utseya drives with the spin into the covers. This game is dawdling along now.
Smith to Cremer, FOUR runs not if Cremer has anything to do with it. He dances out, gets to the pitch and scythes Smith through wide mid on for a boundary
Smith to Cremer, no run
Lee to Utseya, no run begins with a bouncer outside off from over the wicket, he looks for a upper cut and misses
Lee to Utseya, no run full and quick on off stump, Utseya drives into the covers
Lee to Utseya, no run Lee is looking for the yorkers, he's not missing by much. Utseya gets forward and defends down the track
Lee to Utseya, 1 run full again, this time Utseya opens the face and drives into the covers for a single
Lee to Cremer, no run 139.6kph, this is why Steyn loves Lee. He can bowl at this speed, at this age. Yorker a foot outside off, he looks to squeeze it away but can't get it away
Lee to Cremer, no run 144 kph. The fastest old bowler in the world. A mini-achievement for Cremer that he got bat on that thunderbolt outside off
Smith to Utseya, no run the grand old gents are doing well. Ponting now, dives away to his right in cover and stops a single
Smith to Utseya, no run

Smith to Utseya, 1 run beaten in the flight, Utseya nearly holes out to White at deep extra cover as he runs in. He was so short of reaching the flight that his edge carried no where and White's run forward and dive did not help.
Smith to Cremer, 1 run on the pads, worked to the leg side for a single
Smith to Utseya, 1 run
Smith to Cremer, 1 run Cremer pushes a single into the covers for one
Lee to Cremer, FOUR runs Lee's doing everything except get wickets. Bouncer at 141 kph. Cremer is lucky he didn't suffer bodily harm. Hits something and flies fine for four
Lee to Cremer, no run very full outside off and driven into the covers, but straight to the covers

Lee to Cremer, no run for a fleeting moment Cremer did look like Kramer. Full delivery, really pacy and swinging into his pads, Cremer fumbled and stumbled before falling down. It hits the pads and rolls away to the off side
Lee to Cremer, no run Cremer drives with reasonable fluency as Lee delivers one full outside off
Lee to Cremer, 1 run another airy fairy pull as he gets a bouncer at 140 kph. Pops up but lands safely around leg slip. Haddin can't get around in time
Lee to Utseya, no run another one close to being a yorker, dug out down the track.
Smith to Cremer, 1 run played off the pads through square leg for one
Smith to Utseya, no run played off the back foot towards cover
Smith to Utseya, 1 run driven towards long on for a single
Smith to Cremer, 1 run nudged towards long on once again
Smith to Utseya, 1 run full ball on off stump, driven past the bowler towards long on
Smith to Cremer, 1 run forced off the back foot towards long off
Lee to Cremer, no run short of a length ball over off stump, the batsman shapes up to play it but then takes his bat out of the way rather flamboyantly
Lee to Cremer, no run left alone outside off stump
Lee to Cremer, (no ball) 1 run full ball on off stump, driven off the front foot towards mid-off. Lee's over-stepped so there's a free-hit coming up
Lee to Utseya, no run Lee delivers a slower bouncer which Utseya tries to hook and misses
Lee to Utseya, no run fuller and faster on middle stump, driven towards mid-on from the crease
Lee to Utseya, 1 run nudged towards third man for a single
Lee to Cremer, 1 run full ball outside off stump, driven off the front foot towards deep point
Tait to Cremer, no run full ball outside off stump, driven off the front foot towards mid-off and Ponting scores another direct hit at the batsman's end
Tait to Cremer, no run played from the crease towards the off side
Tait to Cremer, 1 run full ball outside off stump, steered towards third man
Tait to Utseya, no run short ball and Utseya takes evasive action
Tait to Utseya, no run full toss on middle stump, flicked firmly but straight to the man at midwicket
Tait to Utseya, no run Tait bowls a fast good-length ball outside off stump and beats the batsman's forward defensive push
Hussey to Cremer, no run played back to the bowler
Hussey to Cremer, no run defended on the front foot
Hussey to Cremer, no run steered towards short third man
Hussey to Cremer, 1 run pushed down the ground for a single
Hussey to Utseya, 2 runs Utseya strides forward and drives through cover point
Hussey to Utseya, 1 run played on the off side off the back foot
Tait to Utseya, FOUR runs Utseya uses Tait's pace and dabs a length delivery past Haddin towards the third-man boundary. Deft and well-executed shot.
Tait to Utseya, no run good length ball on off stump, defended towards the off side from the crease
Tait to Utseya, (no ball) 1 run short of a length ball angling into the right-hander, worked off the hips towards fine leg, Tait's over-stepped so another free-hit coming up
Tait to Cremer, no run Tait bowls the fast bouncer on the free-hit. Cremer backed away to make room and was then too far away from the ball to play a shot
Tait to Cremer, no run fuller ball on off stump, driven off the front foot towards cover
Tait to Cremer, FOUR runs short of a length outside off, Cremer slashes and gets a thick edge that flies wide of Haddin for four
Tait to Cremer, no run full and straight, pushed towards mid-off for a single
Hussey to Utseya, 2 runs driven towards deep cover
Hussey to Price, no run Price pushes forward to play on the off side but gets beaten
Hussey to Price, 1 run driven off the front foot towards long on for one
Hussey to Cremer, no run played back to the bowler this time
Hussey to Cremer, 1 run dabbed off the back foot towards short third man
Johnson to Cremer, no run full ball angling away from the right-hander, the batsman has a waft but misses
Johnson to Cremer, no run good length just outside off stump, pushed from the crease towards point
Johnson to Cremer, 1 run short ball and the batsman pulls through square leg for one
Johnson to Price, 1 run Price tried to let that short of a length ball go but it hit him on the glove and flew over first slip's head towards third man
Johnson to Cremer, no run Cremer plays a nice-looking square drive but can't beat the fielder at point
Johnson to Cremer, FOUR runs short ball and Cremer lines up and pulls superbly all along the ground to the deep square leg boundary
Hussey to Price, no run the reverse-sweep from Price but he can't beat short third man
Hussey to Price, 1 run Price comes down the track and plays the ball towards mid-on
Hussey to Cremer, 1 run Cremer plays the ball towards long-on for one
Hussey to Price, 1 run down the track once again and swatted towards long-on
Hussey to Cremer, no run Cremer aims for long-on but plays it back to the bowler
Hussey to Cremer, 1 run played through square leg for a single
Johnson to Cremer, 1 run played off the back foot through point
Johnson to Price, no run good length on leg and middle, nudged from the crease towards midwicket
Johnson to Price, 1 leg bye Price ducked straight into that short ball from Watson and got hit flush on the helmet. Why they allow leg byes for evasive action I don't know. Daft rule.
Johnson to Mpofu, 1 run full ball outside off stump which Mpofu dabs towards third man
Johnson to Price, no run defended on the leg side off the back foot
Hussey to Mpofu, no run pushed on the off side on the front foot
Hussey to Mpofu, no run Mpofu tries to defend but gets beaten
Hussey to Mpofu, no run defended confidently with a straight bat
Hussey to Mpofu, no run Mpofu gets beaten again outside off stump
Hussey to Mpofu, no run pushed off the front foot towards cover
Hussey to Mpofu, no run driven towards mid-off from the crease
Johnson to Price, no run Johnson sends down another fast bouncer, the batsmen ducks while leaving his bat up like a periscope
Johnson to Price, no run Price swings at a full and wide out and misses
Johnson to Price, no run short of a length delivery from round the wicket, Price wafts and misses
Johnson to Price, no run good length delivery angling into the batsman, defended with a straight bat towards the bowler
Johnson to Price, no run Johnson beats the bat again by pitching one around middle and off and slanting it away from the right-hander. Price tried to drive without moving his feet and missed
Johnson to Price, no run driven off the front foot towards mid-off
Tait to Mpofu, 1 run Tait aims for the yorker first up and Mpofu manages to get some bat on it and play the ball behind square
Tait to Price, no run good length and on off and middle stump, Price stays in his crease and blocks
Tait to Price, 1 run full toss on leg stump and Price flicks firmly towards deep square leg
Tait to Mpofu, 1 leg bye Mpofu's headbutted the ball. He ducked low and right into the line of a short of a length delivery and gets a leg bye for it. Daft rule.
Tait to Price, no run another short ball, Price ducks under it
Tait to Price, no run played off the pads towards the leg side
Johnson to Mpofu, no run Johnson goes round the wicket and bowls a full ball outside off. Mpofu chases and gets beaten

Well that's that from us at ESPNcricinfo today. Join us tomorrow for the game between England and Netherlands which begins at 14.30 local time. On behalf of Nitin and Raghav, this is George Binoy signing off. Cheers.
The presentation ceremony is about to begin.

Zimbabwe stayed in the game for quite a while with a tight bowling performance from their spinners. But their inability to take frequent wickets allowed Australia to post a strong total, which their fast bowlers were able to defend with ease.

21.36 So Australia have wrapped this up by 91 runs. They took a little longer than they would have liked to bowl out Zimbabwe but it's a satisfactory result. Ponting's unbeaten run as World cup captain continues.
Australia won by 91 runs
Player of the match is Shane Watson, AUS
